abstract: Lions Gate Entertainment said its lenders had agreed to amend the terms of a $340 million credit line so that it would not default because Carl C. Icahn had amassed a big stake in the movie studio.
snippet: Lions Gate Entertainment said its lenders had agreed to amend the terms of a $340 million credit line so that it would not default because Carl C. Icahn had amassed a big stake in the movie studio.
lead_paragraph: Lions Gate Entertainment said Tuesday that its lenders had agreed to amend the terms of a $340 million revolving credit line so that it would not default on its debt because the billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn had amassed a big stake in the movie studio, The Associated Press reports.

headline.main: Lenders Ease Up on Lions Gate as Icahn Looms
